intro: Rubus ampelinus, commonly known as the Ampelina blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically black when ripe, though they may also be red or yellow depending on the variety. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
